caption: Last Friday, HTX celebrated its 5th anniversary with not one, but two events! In the morning, Xponents participated in a symbolic dash to HQ from eight satellite offices, mirroring how HTX was first formed in 2019 by bringing together talents from the various Home Team Departments and the Ministry of Home Affairs ( ).Later, over 1,500 Xponents gathered at Marina Bay Sands for a fun-filled dinner and dance themed Hands Across HTX.The event highlighted our journey in enhancing Singapores safety and security, as well as showcased the many innovations we have developed to exponentially empower the Home Team over the last five years.Wed like to extend a big THANK YOU to all Xponents, partners and stakeholderswe wouldnt have reached this milestone without your support.Heres to another five fruitful and eventful years ahead! Link in bio for the story. HTXsg 5thAnniversary OneHomeTeam

The event highlighted our journey in enhancing Singapore's safety and security, as well as showcased the many innovations we have developed to exponentially empower the Home Team over the last five years. We'd like to extend a big THANK YOU to all Xponents, partners, and stakeholders—we wouldn't have reached this milestone without your support. Here's to another five fruitful and eventful years ahead! caption: GLUE, GOAT, NGL, ROUGE, and SMHcan you tell which of these acronyms are evaluation metrics for Large Language Models (LLMs) and which are Gen Z slang? From training HTXs LLMs to understanding global practices on AI governance, our recent Responsible AI Day, organised by HTxAI Enterprise Group, highlighted the importance of integrating privacy, security, and governance to establish and operationalise robust responsible AI policies and practices.We were joined by Resaro, an independent third-party AI test lab, who shared global practices on AI Governance across jurisdictions and law enforcement agencies. Their presentation also touched on how AI systems can be tested to enhance performance and build user confidence.The event drew an engaged audience of about 200 participants attending both in-person and virtually. It concluded with a lively Q&A session.Find out more about what we do at HTX in the fields of data science and AI: HTXsg HTxAI LargeLanguageModel LLM ArtificialIntelligence AIp/s GLUE and ROUGE are evaluation metrics for LLMs.

caption: What a ride! After a series of intense pitching and presentations, the winner of HacX2024 was finally crowned.What is HacX? It is a hackathon jointly organised by HTX and , where young innovators are tasked with solving various challenge statementschallenges faced by Home Team Departments and HTXs Centres of Expertise. These range from safeguarding lives and properties to deterring and solving crimes, and enhancing safety for our frontline.The top 10 teams at the finals gave it their all for a shot at the grand prize of S$10,000. In the end, DataDream Team, Team REAct and Team Group 12 emerged as the top 3 winners, with DataDream Team clinching the grand prize.But it werent just the winners who impressed us with their solutionswe are proud of all the finalists who made it this far.From the semi-finals till now, we have witnessed the passion and unmistakable drive from all the teams to keep improving upon their solutions to keep Singapore safe and secure.Congratulations to the winners and everyone who participated!HTXsg Microsoft HacX Hackathon Innovation

caption: With deadlines to meet, it can be tough to find time to show care for others. But do you know that each small display of empathy can work wonders in building connections and delivering great work?According to our Values Ambassador, Jacqueline Chan, we could all use a bit of empathy. Empathy is not just about feeling sorry for someone, it is about understanding where they are coming from and why they make certain decisions. At HTX, empathy is one of our core values because it fuels innovation. By understanding each others perspectives, we spark fresh ideas and create better solutions together. caption: And thats a wrap for the second eXpresso! session of the year! For this latest townhall, we picked up right where we left off, starting from the HTX Convention which took place in May, before reliving the good vibes of last months HTX Family and Sports Day. We also had fun icebreaker games during which Xponents got to know our new Leads better. Our new Xponent Values guidebook was also launched. In light of our new HTxAI movement, Xponents caught a glimpse of the exciting AI product demos that some of our teams are working on, including the new AI assistance application that will boost workplace productivity within HTX.We ended off with a round of Ask Management Anything (AMA) before refuelling with Project Refuel, an initiative that allows Xponents to mingle and connect over a hearty meal.Well be back with another shot of eXpresso! after National Day, so stay tuned!Is it that sweet? I guess so. Mm, thats that me eXpresso!. HTXsg

caption: Walkthrough scanners capable of detecting potential weaponsboth metal and non-metal in natureand drones that can be flown safely in urban conditions are just two of the innovative proof-of-concepts (POCs) developed by the first batch of global start-ups selected by Hatch, HTX's innovation center for public safety and security. These solutions were developed over the past six months in collaboration with our Home Team champions as part of Hatch's inaugural Open Innovation Challenge (OIC).Here are some highlights as we followed the start-ups from an abandoned warehouse to Marina East Park, where the start-ups brought their POCs to trial in the field for our Home Team departments. It has been an eventful 3.5 days engaging over 2,000 visitors from around the globe at our SG Pavilion. caption: Bonjour! I am here at the biennial Milipol Paris 2023 to support our Singapore Pavilion! This is the first time HTX and its partners are exhibiting the latest technological innovations at this leading event, dedicated to homeland security. I had the honour of meeting Minister Shanmugam who flew in for this exposition. I also spoke with the capable team of engineers from HTX, NCS and ST Engineering, and was exponentially mind-blown by our solutions in Securing Borders, Saving Lives, Safeguarding Public Spaces, and the one closest to my heart Solving Crimes. My apartment in Paris was broken into and turned upside down on a bright and beautiful day in Spring last year. On that fateful day, everything changed for me. The trauma was twofold. First was the burglary itself, and second, the lack of a system robust enough to render the support you need when faced with threats and dangers. Burglary, like pickpocketing, are common transgressions and you just have to learn to live with the bad and the good that comes with living in a big city. Not having closure is the only closure I got. I realized how much we have taken safety and security for granted in Singapore. None of my friends have security alarm systems installed in their homes. I would also choose to believe that you wouldnt be able to get away scot-free if you commit any crimes in Singapore, no matter how petty your misdeeds are. You will be caught, in a very short time, or eventually. It is reassuring to know that so much effort goes into advancing science and technology for homeland security to keep Singapore safe. This to me, is the freedom the world needs. Freedom to be safe. MilipolParis

caption: Bonjour! I am here at the biennial Milipol Paris 2023 to support our Singapore Pavilion! caption: The inaugural HacX! - Hack for Public Safety - jointly organised by HTX and brings together students from pre-university, polytechnic and university levels to harness the power of science and technology to solve crimes, secure borders, and reshape lives. Spanning across 5 weeks, the challenge saw nearly 100 team applications. From this pool, 35 teams were selected to participate in the semi-finals, and 10 teams made it to the finals held on 3 November. From these 10 groups, three winning teams were then chosen by the live audience and judges, and the first-prize winners walked home with $10,000!The participants demonstrated enthusiasm, creativity and innovation as they researched, conceptualised, developed, and pitched their solutions to the panel of judges. Throughout the journey, mentoring was also provided by our HomeTeam Departments and partner, Microsoft.What a great industry partnership to nurture the next generation of STEM talents in Singapore!HTXsg HTScienceandTech OneHomeTeam MicrosoftSingappre Technology Science Engineering

caption: Thank you Singapore Science and Engineering Fair for having us yesterday!Ever-committed to nurturing young STEM talents, Tan Teck Chuan (Director of HTX Platform Systems) once again sat on the judging panel as in previous years, to offer his expertise and inspire the participants. Dr Yuan Yi Di, scientist at HTXs Disruptive Technologies Office, spoke at the event to share more about the computational methods used by HTX scientists to identify unknown drugs so as to secure our borders.We also came bearing gifts (i.e. fun activities!) Not only did we activate the maiden visit of HTXpress, an interactive gamified experience customised for the students, we also brought along our robotic dog where a number of students were thrilled to walk it! Through these activities, the students were able to learn more about HTXs work and impact on homeland security.HTXsg HTScienceandTech SSEF2023

caption: Starting today, the Robotic Escort & Security System (RESS) will be on trial at the Tuas Checkpoint. Conceptualised by engineers from HTX's Robotics, Automation and Unmanned Systems Centre of Expertise (RAUS CoE), this robot escort uses video analytics and environment sensors to self-navigate and guide travellers requiring further assistance from the immigration counters to secondary office areas. "The RESS live trials will provide valuable insights on how the use of robots and automation can enhance 's operations, to enable a safer and more seamless immigration clearance experience," shared Ong Ka Hing, Deputy Director, RAUS CoE. The trial ends on 11 November 2022.Find out more via the link in bio HTXsg HTScienceandTech Robotics Automation OneHomeTeam

caption: We are grateful to receive the Public Sector Transformation (PST) Exemplary Innovator Award alongside , , and .sg! This award for the multi-agency collaboration recognises the innovative work that went into developing OMNII, a transformative digital platform that allows SCDF and hospitals to work together in an integrated manner so as to enhance the delivery of emergency medical services. Future phases of OMNII may include biometric authentication to identify patients and cloud-based AI technology for more intelligent operations and clinical treatment. OMNII is a great testament of a multi-agency, cross-ministry project that embraces technology to bring about higher efficiency and better outcomes for both users and the people we serve, said Ling Kok Yong, Director, HTXs Civil Defence Programme Management Centre (CDPMC). Find out more about OMNII via the link in bio.

caption: Over 1,000 Xponents had a chance to Ask Minister Anything during a special eXpresso! (HTXs bi-monthly townhall) held earlier this month.Thank you Minister for an insightful and engaging dialogue session at our newly-renovated office, sharing your personal anecdotes, as well as responding to questions close to Xponents hearts! HTXsg OneHomeTeamRepost [HTXs eXpresso!]I joined HTXs eXpresso!, its bi-monthly town hall.We had a candid chat on several topics where I shared my views.One question posed to me was, which Marvel or DC character do I think best represents HTX? Batman was suggested, but I think HTX is more like Robin. Not a side-kick, but one that plays a crucial role in supporting the work of our Home Team Departments.I encouraged HTX officers to continue pushing the boundaries of Science and Technology, to transform and enhance our homeland security.OneHomeTeam Ministry of Home Affairs, Singapore HTXSG

caption: Feeling the heat lately? Imagine what our Home Team uniformed officers go through! The warm weather may increase our frontline officers risk of fatigue and even injury due to heat exhaustion. One of the areas our HTXs Human Factors & Simulation CoE explores is the use of human factor science to optimise the design of the suits, tactical gear and daily operational wear worn by officers so as to reduce that risk. Another research breakthrough was to customise a novel moisture-trapping material for practical applications to enhance the performance of frontline officers, which could remarkably lower the likelihood of heat stroke. Check out the story via the link in bio HTXsg HTScienceandTech

caption: Over the past few days, our Xponents took some time to have a bit of fun and recharge at our HTX Carnival , organised by our very own Healthy Lifestyle Committee! caption: Thank you MOS for visiting the Protective, Analytical and Assessment Facility (PAAF) at Pasir Panjang Scanning Station on New Years Day 2022! Working closely with , our CBRNE scientists at PAAF play a key role in securing Singapores borders. Aside from employing the latest technologies to detect and deter hazardous materials in cargo shipments from entering our shores, our scientists also conduct checks and tests as part of biosurveillance, to intercept and counter invisible threats such as viruses and pathogens! Learn more about CBRNE Centre of Expertise via the link in bio. Repost Visited ICA officers at Changi Airfreight Centre and Pasir Panjang Scanning Station on New Years Day. At Changi Airfreight Centre, the officers brought me around to view our clearance booths. Due to the pandemic, more consumers have turned to online shopping for necessities, leisure and even groceries. Air cargo checkpoints have experienced a significant increase in volume of low value e-commerce. In 2020, ICA cleared over 21 million low-value goods through the air cargo checkpoints, which is double from the 10.5 million cleared in 2019. ICA also works closely with CAAS, MOH, Singapore Customs, HSA, SATS and authorised freight forwarders on vaccine imports, clearance and transportation through the air cargo checkpoints. Given that the vaccines have to be stored in very low temperatures, ICA ensures that the clearance process does not undermine the efficacy or delay the vaccine importation. At Pasir Panjang Scanning Station, ICA officers demonstrated how anomalies are detected during cargo inspection. Thank you ICA, for keeping our borders safe and secure. Wishing everyone a joyous start to 2022. GuardiansOfOurBorders OneHomeTeam HTXsg HTScienceandTech

caption: Thank you MOS for visiting the Protective, Analytical and Assessment Facility (PAAF) at Pasir Panjang Scanning Station on New Years Day 2022! Working closely with , our CBRNE scientists at PAAF play a key role in securing Singapores borders. Aside from employing the latest technologies to detect and deter hazardous materials in cargo shipments from entering our shores, our scientists also conduct checks and tests as part of biosurveillance, to intercept and counter invisible threats such as viruses and pathogens! Learn more about CBRNE Centre of Expertise via the link in bio. Repost Visited ICA officers at Changi Airfreight Centre and Pasir Panjang Scanning Station on New Years Day. At Changi Airfreight Centre, the officers brought me around to view our clearance booths. Due to the pandemic, more consumers have turned to online shopping for necessities, leisure and even groceries. Air cargo checkpoints have experienced a significant increase in volume of low value e-commerce. In 2020, ICA cleared over 21 million low-value goods through the air cargo checkpoints, which is double from the 10.5 million cleared in 2019. ICA also works closely with CAAS, MOH, Singapore Customs, HSA, SATS and authorised freight forwarders on vaccine imports, clearance and transportation through the air cargo checkpoints. Given that the vaccines have to be stored in very low temperatures, ICA ensures that the clearance process does not undermine the efficacy or delay the vaccine importation. At Pasir Panjang Scanning Station, ICA officers demonstrated how anomalies are detected during cargo inspection. Thank you ICA, for keeping our borders safe and secure. Wishing everyone a joyous start to 2022. GuardiansOfOurBorders OneHomeTeam HTXsg HTScienceandTech

caption: Thank you Minister .ylm for supporting our inaugural HTX Investigators Challenge! Apart from the sense of achievement that came with every solved challenge, we hope participants also went away with a better understanding of how the engineers and scientists at HTXsg leverage Science and Technology to augment the Home Team frontline in keeping Singapore safe and secure. Find out more about what went down at HTXIC via the link in bio! HTScienceandTechRepost .ylm This year marks the inaugural HTX Investigators Challenge (HTXIC).I am heartened to see so many youths come together to pit their wits and skills against one another in the Capture-the-Flag (CTF) event, where groups of participants compete in a customised gamified challenge arena virtually.Unlike other CTF events, HTXIC is a first of its kind event filled with challenges beyond the usual cybersecurity domain. It also involves the science and engineering domains which focus on safety and security areas that are under the Home Teams purview. Science and technology innovations are essential in augmenting our Home Teams efforts to ensure operational efficiency and safety of our officers.I hope that such events will help to groom more talents and allow them to discover their fullest potential, thereby contributing to a SmartNation and a safer Singapore.Lastly, congratulations to the winning team of the first HTX Investigators Challenge T0X1C V4P0R. And to the rest of the teams, great work! - Jo TeoOneHomeTeam

caption: What does it mean to keep the lights on when it pertains to Singapores safety and security? caption: When it comes to preparing our Home Team frontline officers for dangerous and demanding missions, not only is their physical safety important, but equally so, is their mental ability to manage the cognitive load required. caption: If youve seen our post (bit.ly/cicwinner2019 - link in bio) on the winner of CIC 2019, heres Zhen Hao () giving us an update and sharing with us his experience on attending the RSA Conference 2020 in San Francisco last weekOur future intern said he had an eye-opening and mind-blowing experience, gaining new perspectives on the current security challenges from the expert-led sessions and keynotes. He stated that it was like a step into the future with countless exhibitions and each of them showcasing cutting-edge technologies that are not on the market, and solutions that were previously thought impossible to create. Another highlight he mentioned was meeting some of the creators of RSA up-close at the conference!Zhen Hao was thrilled to broaden his horizons by attending the physical workshops and trying car hacking and radio frequency (RF) hacking. He successfully manipulated the electronic device in the car such as the speedometer, door locks, starting the car and even deploying the airbags. He thoroughly enjoyed the hands-on experience of compromising a system as such an attack was only theoretically taught in school.It appears that Zhen Haos all-expense-paid trip has been most rewarding for him. CIC 2020 is happening again on 13-14 July this year! For those interested to join, look out for more details of enrolment for participation in May 2020! Follow our Instagram for updates!cybersecuritychallengeRSAConferenceSingaporeInstituteofTechnology

cleaned_caption:
If you've seen our post on the winner of CIC 2019, here's an update sharing the experience of attending the RSA Conference 2020 in San Francisco last week. Our future intern said he had an eye-opening and mind-blowing experience, gaining new perspectives on the current security challenges from the expert-led sessions and keynotes. He stated that it was like a step into the future with countless exhibitions, each showcasing cutting-edge technologies that are not on the market, and solutions that were previously thought impossible to create. Another highlight mentioned was meeting some of the creators of RSA up-close at the conference! 

He was thrilled to broaden his horizons by attending the physical workshops and trying car hacking and radio frequency (RF) hacking. He successfully manipulated electronic devices in the car such as the speedometer, door locks, starting the car, and even deploying the airbags. He thoroughly enjoyed the hands-on experience of compromising a system as such an attack was only theoretically taught in school. 

It appears that the all-expense-paid trip has been most rewarding. CIC 2020 is happening again on 13-14 July this year! For those interested to join, look out for more details of enrolment for participation in May 2020! Follow our Instagram for updates!

caption: When Zhen Hao () participated in the inaugural Cybersecurity Investigators' Challenge 2019, heneverimagined he'd emergeawinner and earn himselfcash prize anda paid trip to San Franciscoto attendthe RSA Conference 2020!Recalling his intriguing and fascinating experience duringthe competition, the undergraduate at the Singapore Institute of Technology () quipped thatahighlight for him was "experiencing various real-life scenarios like live information gathering of volatile data from a computer to collecting fingerprints from a suspected plastic cup".Zhen Hao also felt elated when he managed to successfully solder a simple circuit board in order to communicate with a router management interfacea unique experience that helped him take a step back and appreciate the most essential part of a computer - the electronics and system architecture".As he makes his way to the RSA Conferencewhich started on 24 Feb, heis looking forwardto "many cutting-edge security technologiesbeing revealed at the conference".Followour Instagramforthe nextupdateon RSA Conference from Zhen Hao!cybersecuritychallengeRSAConferenceSingaporeInstituteofTechnology(Photos: Singapore Cybersecurity Consortium, Zhen Hao)
